ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

Notes: R = Right; L = Left; B = Both

ElementDescription: Indicates presence or absense of simultaneous imaging with psychophysiological data collection
Notes: 0 = no simultaneous imaging; 1 = imaging performed during psychophysiological data collection

ValueRange: MRI; PET; CT; SPECT; ultrasound; FA; X-Ray; spectroscopy; microscopy; EEG
Notes: Computed Radiography; Computed Tomography; External Camera Photography; FA; General Microscopy; MRI; Magnetic Resonance; Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy; Nuclear Medicine; Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography; Ultrasound

ElementDescription: Indicates presence or absense of task stimuli during collection of psychophysiological data collection.
Notes: 0 = no stimulus presented during data collection; 1 = stimulus presented during data collection

ElementDescription: Sampling rate of data collection in Hz
Note any hardware or data filter settings used during collection
Description of how participants were connected to the data collection hardware
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
